definition: to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: This was done by a number of means , including chipping at the buildings with pickaxes .
sentences.chinese: 这是做了一些手段，包括插话在建筑物与镐。

sentences.english: My little son nipped in with a smart question.
sentences.chinese: 我的小儿子插话问了一个俏皮的问题。

sentences.english: Sveral times the chief tried to get a word in, but to no avail.
sentences.chinese: 酋长几次都想插话，但都被她打断了。

sentences.english: Mother told her son not to whip in while others are talking.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈对儿子说别人谈话时不要突然插话。

sentences.english: Such a nice man, put in the mother.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个多好的人呀，她的母亲插话道。

sentences.english: Flower arrangement is an elegant art.
sentences.chinese: 插话花是一门高雅艺术。

sentences.english: Interjected yet another high school student.
It is impolite of children to jump in when their parents are talking business.
sentences.chinese: 父母谈正经事时，孩子插话是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: Interruptions were swept aside with a wave of the hand.
sentences.chinese: 手一挥就把别人的插话甩到一边去了。

sentences.english: Jacob was silent so long that Livvy interposed.
sentences.chinese: 雅各布沉默的时间太长了，莉薇只好插话了。

sentences.english: Suddenly, one of his little grandsons said:"Grandpapa!” The king took no notice of this interruption, and went on talking to the King of Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 国王没有注意到他的插话，继续和瑞典国王讲话。

sentences.english: Just then, the lawyer piped up.
Those who interpose is young people, lanky stature, body cowboy clothes.
sentences.chinese: 插话进来的是一个年轻人，瘦长身材，一身牛仔衣。

sentences.english: You may wonder, is he listening to me or rehearsing his next interruption?
sentences.chinese: 你会感到困惑，他是在听我说话，还是在准备插话？

sentences.english: The servant struck in with the remark that Mr. Lee was out one hour ago.
sentences.chinese: 仆人突然插话说李先生一小时前就出去了。

definition: to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to question/to ask/to raise a question
to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
socket (for an electric plug)/to interrupt (sb speaking)/to butt in
to help to resolve a dispute/to smooth things over
